tantusdem: <entryFree id="n47474" type="main" key="tantusdem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantus-dem</orth>, <itype>tantădem, tantundem</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">just so great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as great</hi> (as an <pos>adj.</pos> rare, but freq. and class. in the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n47474.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo bene facere tantundem est periculum, Quantum bono male facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ita legatum esset: Titia uxor mea tantandem partem habeat, quantulam unus heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia forte tantandem pecuniam Titio debuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">si postea tantandem summam a domino mutuatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantidem ponderis petitio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:26" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 5, 26 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47474.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47474.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantundem</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tantumdem</orth>), <hi rend="ital">just so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus tantundem detur in cellam, quantum semper datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:87:section=201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 87, § 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde qui morte ejus tantundem capiat, quantum omnes heredes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:19:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam pedum XX. directis lateribus duxit, ut ejus solum tantundem pateret, quantum summa labra distabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tantundem scio, quantum tu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi subiti nihil est, tantundem'st mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem argenti, quantum miles debuit, Dedit huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem apud posteros meruit bonae famae, quantum malae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae tantundem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 37, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam pol hinc tantundem accipies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 35, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat vallus in altitudinem pedum decem: tantundem ejus valli agger in latitudinem patebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ex parvo nobis tantundem haurire relinquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 237: nec vincet ratio, tantundem ut peccet idemque, Qui teneros caules alieni fregerit horti, Et qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique ad inferos tantundem viae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen interpres tantundem juveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium atque impetus non tantundem exigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumdem in utrosque licere fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantundem praetor facit et de his,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47474.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> (of price) <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantīdem</orth> (i scanned short, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 31</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">tantidem emptum postulat sibi tradier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem decurionum ac municipum omnium tantidem, quanti fidem suam, fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 115</bibl></cit>: tantidem quasi feta canes sine dentibu' latrat, <cb n="TARC" /> Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 518 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">decrepitus senex tantidem est, quasi sit signum pictum in pariete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantidem ille illi rursus iniciat manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tanusius: <entryFree id="n47475" type="main" key="Tanu_sius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tanūsius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Tanusiorum capita demere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47475.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp.: Tanusius Geminus, <hi rend="ital">a Latin historian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales Tanusii scis quam ponderosi sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taos: <entryFree id="n47476" type="greek" key="ta^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">taw/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of precious stone of the colors of the peacock</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tapanta: <entryFree id="n47477" type="greek" key="ta^panta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăpanta</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ pa/nta,</foreign> <sense id="n47477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">all things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in caelum abiit et Trimalchionis tapanta est,</quote> <trans><tr>the all in all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tapete: <entryFree id="n47478" type="main" key="ta^pe_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăpēte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n47478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. acc. m.</hi> tapeta fulgentem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:270" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 270</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> tapetia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 17, 28</bibl>; but <case>nom.</case> tapeta, from unused tapetum, Lucil. ap. Prob. p. 130: tapetae, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl> Müll.; Placid. Gloss.; <hi rend="ital">acc. m.</hi> tapetas pulcros, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 358</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> tapetibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 638</bibl>; Varr ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tapetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 277</bibl></cit> Serv. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:147:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 147, 1</bibl>; cf. the Gr. forms from <foreign lang="greek">ta/phs,</foreign> and v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 570 sq.); cloth wrought with figures in different colors, for covering walls, floors, tables, couches, etc., <hi rend="ital">a carpet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tapestry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hangings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coverlet</hi>, etc. (syn. stragulum); <hi rend="ital">sing. nom.</hi> tapete, Turp. and Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 229, 7</bibl>, and 542, 18; <case>abl.</case> tapete, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:64" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taphrae: <entryFree id="n47479" type="main" key="Taphrae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taphrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/frai.</foreign> <sense id="n47479.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The isthmus of the Tauric Chersonese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47479.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town upon this isthmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tapinoma: <entryFree id="n47480" type="greek" key="ta^pi_no_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăpīnōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tapei/nwma,</foreign> <sense id="n47480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a low</hi> or <hi rend="ital">humble expression</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tapinosis: <entryFree id="n47481" type="greek" key="ta^pi_no_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăpīnōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tapei/nwsis,</foreign> <sense id="n47481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a depreciation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taposiris: <entryFree id="n47482" type="main" key="Taposiris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taposiris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 29, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:100" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 31, § 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tappulus: <entryFree id="n47483" type="main" key="Tappu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tappŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Villius Tappulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
taprobane: <entryFree id="n47484" type="main" key="Ta_pro^ba^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tāprŏbănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*taproba/nh,</foreign> <sense id="n47484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Indian Ocean</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ceylon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 777</bibl>.—Also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tā-prŏbăna</orth>, App. de Mundo, p. 60, 16.</sense></entryFree>
tapullam: <entryFree id="n47485" type="main" key="tapullam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tapullam</orth> <itype>legem convivalem ficto nomine conscripsit jocoso carmine Valerius Valentinus</itype>, cujus meminit Lucilius hoc modo: <sense id="n47485.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tapullam rident legem congerrae optimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tarandrus: <entryFree id="n47486" type="main" key="ta^randrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tărandrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an animal found in northern countries;</hi> acc. to Cuvier, <hi rend="ital">the reindeer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
taranis: <entryFree id="n47487" type="main" key="Ta^ra^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărănis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of Jupiter among the Gauls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 446</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so perh. TANARVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2054</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taranucnus: <entryFree id="n47488" type="gloss" key="Taranucnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taranucnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a German deity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2055 sq.</bibl>; Cod. Inscr. 50 Steiner.</sense></entryFree>
taras: <entryFree id="n47489" type="main" key="Ta^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăras</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/ras.</foreign> <sense id="n47489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founder of the city of Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:103" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 103</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47489.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The city of Tarentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 376</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taratalla: <entryFree id="n47490" type="greek" key="Ta^ra^talla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărătalla</orth>, <sense id="n47490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a humorous name of a cook</hi>, taken from Homer (Il. 1, 465): <foreign lang="greek">*mi/stullon t) a)/ra t) a)/lla</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi Mistyllus cocus, Aemiliane, vocatur, Dicetur quare non Taratalla mihi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:51:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 51, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taratantara: <entryFree id="n47491" type="hapax" key="ta^ra^tanta^ra^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tărătantără</orth>, <itype>an onomatopee</itype>, representing the sound of the tuba: at tuba terribili sonitu taratantara dixit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 842</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 452 Vahl.).</entryFree>
tarbelli: <entryFree id="n47492" type="main" key="Tarbelli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarbelli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extending southwards from Burdigala to the Pyrenees</hi>, in the neighborhood of the mod. <hi rend="ital">Dax</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47492.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarbellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tarbellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 2, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47492.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarbellĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tarbellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 421</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47492.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tar-bellĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tarbellian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aturus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the river Adour</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 24, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">origo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prof. 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tarcho: <entryFree id="n47493" type="main" key="Tarcho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarcho</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarchon</orth>, <itype>ōnis or ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noble Etrurian who assisted Æneas against Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 506</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 603</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 727</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:474" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 474</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarcondimotus: <entryFree id="n47494" type="main" key="Tarcondimotus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarcondimotus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Cilician</hi> <cb n="TARD" /> <hi rend="ital">prince and faithful ally of the Romans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardabilis: <entryFree id="n47495" type="hapax" key="tarda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardo</etym>, <sense id="n47495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that renders slow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rigor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tardatio: <entryFree id="n47496" type="main" key="tarda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarde: <entryFree id="n47497" type="main" key="tarde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tardus <sense id="n47497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tardesco: <entryFree id="n47498" type="hapax" key="tardesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become slow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardescit lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>grows sluggish</tr>, <tr>hesitates</tr>, <tr>stammers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardicors: <entryFree id="n47499" type="hapax" key="tardi^cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭcors</orth>, <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardus-cor</etym>, <sense id="n47499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow-minded</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of a dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stolid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniosos, tardicordes, fatuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enchir. 103" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enchir. 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tardigemulus: <entryFree id="n47500" type="hapax" key="tardi^ge^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭgĕmŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tardĭng-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardus-gemo</etym>, <sense id="n47500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow-moaning</hi>: tardingemulo senio oppressus, Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardigenulo, i. e. tardigrado (cf.: tarda trementi Genua labant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 431</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
tardigradus: <entryFree id="n47501" type="hapax" key="tardi^gra^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭgrădus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardusgradior</etym>, <sense id="n47501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow-paced</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy-paced</hi>: quadrupes, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl> (Trag. v. 2 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tardiloquus: <entryFree id="n47502" type="hapax" key="tardi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n47502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow-speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow of speech</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardipes: <entryFree id="n47503" type="main" key="tardi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tardus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n47503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowfooted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy-footed;</hi> hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">limping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">halting</hi>, an epithet of Vulcan: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 36, 7</bibl></cit>; and of the same, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin et Tardipedi sacris jam rite solutis,</quote> <trans><tr>of slow-foot</tr>, <tr>tardy-foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:419" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 419</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tarditas: <entryFree id="n47504" type="main" key="tardi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47504.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of motion or action: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritati tarditas, non debilitas (contraria est),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:11:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu corrigam tarditatem tum equis tum quadrigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculis tarditati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onerariae navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mula effrenis et tarditatis indomitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:46:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 46, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moram et tarditatem afferre bello,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditas et procrastinatio in rebus gerendis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatio ac tarditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosti hominis tarditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si etiam affert tarditatem ista sententia ad Dolabellam persequendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter tarditatem sententiarum moramque rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta fuit operis tarditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audientium,</quote> <trans><tr>dulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 83</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:59" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 2, 28, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <trans><tr>slow effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritates tarditatesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavendum est, ne tarditatibus utamur in ingressu mollioribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47504.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the mind, <hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heaviness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:229" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 68, 229</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii (connected with stupor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tarditas animi et stupor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid adjectius tarditate et stultitiā dici potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio tarditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tardities: <entryFree id="n47505" type="hapax" key="tardi^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi> (ante-class. form for tarditas): multa amittuntur tarditie et socordiā, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 278 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tarditudo: <entryFree id="n47506" type="main" key="tardi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardiness</hi> (ante-class. form for tarditas): podagrosi estis ac vicistis cochleam tarditudine, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 29</bibl>: segnes somno et tarditudine, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 20</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 69 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tardiuscule: <entryFree id="n47507" type="main" key="tardi^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭuscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tardiusculus</etym>, <sense id="n47507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat slowly</hi>: venire, M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardiusculus: <entryFree id="n47508" type="main" key="tardi^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tardus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slowish</hi> (ante- and postclass.): mulier, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 198, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tardo: <entryFree id="n47509" type="main" key="tardo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n47509.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impede</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: remoror, impedio): aut impedire profectionem aut certe tardare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes (alta harena),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at non tardatus casu neque territus heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardante sagittā Interdum genua impediunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 746</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos Etesiae vehementissime tardarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritatem insequendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:14" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus Romanos ad insequendum tardabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas non altitudo montis tardare potuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 52</bibl></cit>; 3, 70; <pb n="1843" /> <cb n="TARD" /> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:57:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 57, § 130</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentorum administrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum in persequendi studio maeror, hos laetitia tardavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem socors ipsius natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor, ne exercitus nostri tardentur animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ratio pudoris a praesentis laude tardaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius adire tardari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47509.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tarry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">linger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delay</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: cunctor, moror): tu mitte mihi quaeso obviam litteras, numquid putes rei publicae nomine tardandum esse nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuci tardantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 11, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors non tardat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 22, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heb. 10, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardor: <entryFree id="n47510" type="hapax" key="tardor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tardus</etym>, <sense id="n47510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness</hi> (anteclass. form for tarditas): versuum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 229, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tardus: <entryFree id="n47511" type="main" key="tardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tardus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy</hi> (freq. and class.; syn.: lentus, languidus). </sense><sense id="n47511.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of motion or action: <cit><quote lang="la">velox an tardus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardi sumus nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate tardiores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">fatuus est, insulsus, tardus, stertit noctes et dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptor non inertiā aut inopiā tardior fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualem existimas, qui in adulterio deprehenditur? tardum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo erat adeo tardus aut fugiens laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda aliqua et languida pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 206</bibl></cit>: aves, quas Hispania tardas appellat, Graecia <foreign lang="greek">w)ti/das,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ubi reliquos esse tardiores vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad injuriam tardiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardior ad judicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deponendum imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad discedendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulus in decedendo erit, ut audio, tardior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proci loripedes, tardissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unpropitious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 41</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47511.2" n="b" level="4"> Of things concr. and abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">tardiores tibicinis modi et cantus remissiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia tarda et spissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti tarda subvectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta deum tarda et sera nimis, Cic. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64: sic mihi tarda fluunt tempora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctes,</quote> <trans><tr>coming on late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardiora fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anne novum tardis sidus te mensibus addas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the long summer months</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:4:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda Genua labant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that makes one move slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 19</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">passus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 568" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that lingers long on the palate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 293" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 293</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus fugae,</quote> <trans><tr>delaying his flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:547" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 547</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere tectos Numquam tarda dolos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:234" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 234</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47511.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slow of apprehension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47511.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Prorsum nihil intellego. <hi rend="ital">Sy.</hi> Hui, tardus es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus hebetes et tardi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis indociles tardique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui forte sit tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardi ingenii est, rivulos consectari, fontes rerum non videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardo ingenio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47511.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech or of a speaker, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not rapid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measured</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deliberate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utroque genere dicendi principia tarda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardior pronuntiatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarda et supina compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus in cogitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:59:216" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 59, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus non tardus sententiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 70, 247</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tardē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n47511.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tarde percipere (opp. celeriter arripere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 3</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardius moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 28 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardissime judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47511.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Late</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not in time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not early</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11</bibl>, <cb n="TARQ" /> 14, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardissime,</quote> <trans><tr>at latest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10</bibl></cit>, §§ 51 and 56: quam tardissime, <hi rend="ital">as late as possible</hi>, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarentum: <entryFree id="n47512" type="main" key="Ta^rentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărentus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:434" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 430</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/ras,</foreign> <sense id="n47512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Lower Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded by the Spartan Parthenians</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Taranto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:50 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 50 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tarentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:1" default="NO">7, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 84</bibl></cit>: purpura, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 207</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tărentīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tarentum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tarentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:15" default="NO">20, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
targines: <entryFree id="n47513" type="main" key="Targines"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Targines</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of</hi> Magna Graecia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 10, 15, § 96</bibl> (al. Thagines or Thargines).</sense></entryFree>
tarichea: <entryFree id="n47514" type="main" key="Tariche_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarichēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lake of Galilee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taricheae: <entryFree id="n47515" type="main" key="Tariche_^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarichē^ae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Galilee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Tiberias</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El-Kerak</hi>, Cassiod. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 11, 2</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tari-chēa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarichaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 15, 15, § 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarinates: <entryFree id="n47516" type="main" key="Tarina_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarinātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the Sabine country</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tariotae: <entryFree id="n47517" type="main" key="Tariotae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tariotae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarmes: <entryFree id="n47518" type="main" key="tarme^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tarmĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root tero; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/rw,</foreign> to bore</etym>, <sense id="n47518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worm that eats wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a woodworm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 140</bibl>.—Written also <orth extent="full" lang="la">termes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 256</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarnis: <entryFree id="n47519" type="main" key="Tarnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Gaul falling into the Garonne</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Tarn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> in Mos. 465</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 24, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarpa: <entryFree id="n47520" type="main" key="Tarpa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Maecius.</entryFree>
tarpeius: <entryFree id="n47521" type="main" key="Tarpe_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarpēius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarpēia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name;</hi> so esp., </sense><sense id="n47521.1" n="1" level="3"> Sp. Tarpeius, <hi rend="ital">the father of Tarpeia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who opened the citadel to the Sabines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47521.2" n="2" level="3"> Tarpeia, <hi rend="ital">a Roman maiden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who treacherously opened the citadel to the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and for her reward was killed by the weight of their arms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which they cast upon her</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 776</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47521.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarpēius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tarpeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans><tr>the Tarpeian Rock</tr>, <tr>the name of a rock on the Capitoline Hill</tr>, <tr>from which criminals were thrown headlong</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=41" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 41</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 55</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=343" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 343</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tarpeio fodientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Tarpeium raptus (Metellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <trans><tr>the citadel on the Capitoline Hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, (5), 4, 29; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:866" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 866</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <trans><tr>Capitoline Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 7; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:78" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 78</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and dei,</quote> <trans><tr>who were worshipped on the Capitoline Hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:863" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 863</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae,</quote> <trans><tr>given to victors in the Capitoline games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:41:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 41, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 54, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>named after a certain Tarpeius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitia,</quote> <trans><tr>of a Tarpeia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47521.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarpēiānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tarpeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Tarpeian Hill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 6</bibl></cit> and 8.</sense></entryFree>
tarpessita: <entryFree id="n47522" type="main" key="tarpessi_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tarpessīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = trapezita, q. v.</entryFree>
tarquinii: <entryFree id="n47523" type="main" key="Tarqui^ni^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient and important town of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Trachina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 4</bibl>; 26, 3; 27, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47523.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tarquinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarquinian.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Tarquin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of the fifth king of Rome</hi>, who came from Tarquinii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:35 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 35 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">and of his descendants</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">the last Roman king</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:46 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 46 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:687" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 687</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:646" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 646</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47523.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the family of the Tarquins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarquinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47523.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tar-quĭnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town of Tarquinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarquinian</hi>: ager, Cic. <cb n="TARU" /> Div. 2, 23, 50; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Caecin. 4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tarquiniensi,</quote> <trans><tr>in the district of Tarquinii</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tarquinii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tarquinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 12</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarquitius: <entryFree id="n47524" type="main" key="Tarqui^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarquĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Etruscan proper name;</hi> so esp. <hi rend="ital">the Etruscan Tarquitius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who wrote on divination</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl>; Plin. ind. libri 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tar-quĭtĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tarquitius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tarracina: <entryFree id="n47525" type="main" key="Tarra^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăcīna</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Terr-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tarrakina</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*traxi/nh</foreign> (cf. Trachas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 717</bibl>; the first a in Tarracina inserted like the u in Alcumena, Aesculapius, etc.), <sense id="n47525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called</hi> Anxur, now <hi rend="ital">Terracina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3 al.</bibl>—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăcīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăcĭnensis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Terr-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tarracina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarracinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceparius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 3</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarră-cĭnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tarracina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Tarracinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarraco: <entryFree id="n47526" type="main" key="Tarra^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăco</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarracon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tarragona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 22</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăcōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tarraco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tarraconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tarragenses: <entryFree id="n47527" type="main" key="Tarra^genses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarrăgenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarsatica: <entryFree id="n47528" type="main" key="Tarsatica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarsatica</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 21, 25, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarsus: <entryFree id="n47529" type="main" key="Tarsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Cilicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tersoos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 225</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 66. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarsensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tarsus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.— Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarsenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tarsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tartarus: <entryFree id="n47530" type="main" key="Tarta^rus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartărus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in <number>plur.</number> (on prosodial grounds): <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartăra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/rtaros,</foreign> <number>plur.</number> <foreign lang="greek">*ta/rtara,</foreign> <sense id="n47530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tartarus</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; in prose, inferi); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1012" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1012</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 577</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:116" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 116</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:966" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 966</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1126" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 243</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 371</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 423</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 21 et saep. al.—Personified: Tartarus pater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:258" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 258</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47530.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartărĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the infernal regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tartarean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrica plaga, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: antrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 712</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 676</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cerberus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acheron,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phlegethon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sorores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Furies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 328</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 66</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vox Alectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 514</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47530.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartărĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tartarean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infernal;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">horrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartarino cum dixit Ennius, horrendo et terribili Verrius vult accipi, a Tartaro, qui locus apud inferos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll.: corpore Tartarino prognata Paluda virago, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 37</bibl> ib.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">delator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47531" type="main" key="Tarta^rus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Italy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tariaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tartessus: <entryFree id="n47532" type="main" key="Tartessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartessus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tartēsus</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient maritime town of Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">El Rocadillo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near S. Roque</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl>;
