<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 399</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:399" default="NO">5, 399</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47532.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartessĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tartēsĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tartessus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tartessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:538" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 538</bibl></cit>: muraena, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:16:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 16, 5</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:673" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 673</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:5" default="NO">15, 5</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartessĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tartessus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 154</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47532.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartessĭăcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tartēsĭăcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Tartessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>lettuce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:370" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 370</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Spanish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iberus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 286</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47532.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tartessis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tartēsis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tartessian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactuca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:192" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tarum: <entryFree id="n47533" type="main" key="tarum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tarum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">aloe-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 20, 44, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarusates: <entryFree id="n47534" type="main" key="Tarusa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarusātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Aquitanian<pb n="1844" /> <cb n="TAUR" />  Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tarutius: <entryFree id="n47535" type="main" key="Tarutius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tarutius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Tarutius Firmanus,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated astrologer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tasconium: <entryFree id="n47536" type="main" key="tasconi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tasconĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clayey kind of earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tasgetius: <entryFree id="n47537" type="main" key="Tasgeti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tasgetĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prince of the Carnutes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tasis: <entryFree id="n47538" type="greek" key="ta^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta/sis,</foreign> <sense id="n47538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exertion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis = intentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, 939</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tat: <entryFree id="n47539" type="hapax" key="ta^t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăt</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exlamation of surprise, <sense id="n47539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">what! strange!</hi> Tat! ecquis est? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 18</bibl>; cf. tatae.</sense></entryFree>
tata: <entryFree id="n47540" type="main" key="ta^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/tta;</foreign> Sanscr. tātas, = papa</etym>. <sense id="n47540.0" n="I" level="1"> A name by which young children, speaking imperfectly, call their father, as with us, <hi rend="ital">dad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daddy</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 81, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2813 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4943</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47540.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringer up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rearer</hi>, analog. to mamma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 101, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tatae: <entryFree id="n47541" type="hapax" key="tatae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tatae</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, an exclamation of surprise, <sense id="n47541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">so! the deuce! Sa.</hi> Fac tu hoc modo. <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> At tu hoc modo. <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Babae! <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Tatae! <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Papae! <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Pax! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 31</bibl>; cf. tat.</sense></entryFree>
tatius: <entryFree id="n47542" type="main" key="Ta^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tătĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, T., <sense id="n47542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who afterwards reigned jointly with Romulus</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 947</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 113 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 52. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47542.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tatius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4, 31</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47542.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tătĭenses</orth> (sometimes also called, after his praenomen Titus, Titienses), <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the three Roman centuries of cavalry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:9:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 9, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tattaeus: <entryFree id="n47543" type="main" key="Tattaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tattaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n47543.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <trans><tr>the name of a marsh in Phrygia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:99" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 45, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tatula: <entryFree id="n47544" type="main" key="ta^tu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tătŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tata</etym>, <sense id="n47544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daddy</hi>, Inscr. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 4, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tau: <entryFree id="n47545" type="main" key="tau1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tau</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, a Celtic word of unknown meaning, Verg. Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 6</bibl>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47546" type="main" key="tau2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tau</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n47546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the Greek</hi> T, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Lit. Monos. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et signa tau super frontes virorum gementium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 9, 4</bibl></cit> (al. thau).</sense></entryFree>
taulantii: <entryFree id="n47547" type="main" key="Taulanti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taulantĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 22, 26, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taulantĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Taulantian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:294" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 294</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taum: <entryFree id="n47548" type="main" key="Taum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an arm of the sea in Britain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Firth of Tay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taunus: <entryFree id="n47549" type="main" key="Taunus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taunus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain range in Western Germany</hi> (<hi rend="ital">between Frankfort and Mayence</hi>), now called <hi rend="ital">Taunus</hi>, or the <hi rend="ital">Höhe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taura: <entryFree id="n47550" type="greek" key="taura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tau=ra,</foreign> <sense id="n47550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hybrid cow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a free-martin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:22:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. Fest. pp. 352 and 353.</sense></entryFree>
taureus: <entryFree id="n47551" type="main" key="taure^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurus</etym>, <sense id="n47551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a bull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of oxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taurine</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n47551.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: vincla, i. e. <hi rend="ital">taurean bands</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> expression to denote <hi rend="ital">glue</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1071</bibl>: terga, <hi rend="ital">bulls</hi>' <hi rend="ital">hides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 706</bibl>; also, meton., for <hi rend="ital">a drum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:342" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 342</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47551.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47551.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A whip of bull</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:492" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 492</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47551.4" n="2" level="3"> = taura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tauri: <entryFree id="n47552" type="main" key="Tauri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tauri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Taurians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living in what is now Crimea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who sacrificed foreigners to Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 45</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Taurians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Taurian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tauric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chersonesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:80" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:386" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taurianum: <entryFree id="n47553" type="main" key="Tauri^a_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bruttia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tauricornis: <entryFree id="n47554" type="hapax" key="tauri^cornis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĭcornis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurus-cornu</etym>, <sense id="n47554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bull-horned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tauricornous</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 222.</sense></entryFree>
tauricus: <entryFree id="n47555" type="main" key="Tauri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Tauri.</entryFree>
taurifer: <entryFree id="n47556" type="hapax" key="tauri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurusfero</etym>, <sense id="n47556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bull-bearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeding</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">supporting bulls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 473</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tauriformis: <entryFree id="n47557" type="hapax" key="tauri^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurus-forma</etym>, <sense id="n47557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bull-shaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tauriform</hi>, an epithet of the river Aufidus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurigenus: <entryFree id="n47558" type="hapax" key="tauri^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n47558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bull-born</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">begotten by</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proceeding</hi> <cb n="TAUR" /> <hi rend="ital">from a bull</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 463 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
taurii: <entryFree id="n47559" type="main" key="Tauri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurĭi lūdi</orth>, <sense id="n47559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">games at Rome in the</hi> Circus Flaminius, <hi rend="ital">held in honor of the infernal gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=154" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 154</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 22</bibl>; Fest. pp. 350 and 351 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl>.—Hence, Taurium aes, quod in ludos Taurios consumitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
taurini: <entryFree id="n47560" type="main" key="Tauri_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Northern Italy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the modern Turin</hi> (Augusta Taurinorum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 66</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Taurini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Taurine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:646" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 646</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taurinus: <entryFree id="n47561" type="main" key="tauri_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurus</etym>, <sense id="n47561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to bulls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oxen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bull</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taurine</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus (Eridani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:197" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gluten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1069</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 40, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 68, § 232</bibl></cit>: tergum, <hi rend="ital">a bull</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s hide</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 368</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also, tympana (cf. taureus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Stil. 2, 365</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and pulsus,</quote> <trans><tr>on a drum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47562" type="main" key="Tauri_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Taurini.</entryFree>
tauris: <entryFree id="n47563" type="main" key="Tauris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tauris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Illyria</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 45, 1 sq.</sense></entryFree>
taurisci: <entryFree id="n47564" type="main" key="Taurisci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurisci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine tribe in Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19, 23, § 133</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tauriscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Taurisci</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tauriscus: <entryFree id="n47565" type="main" key="Tauriscus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tauriscus</orth>, v. Taurisci.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47566" type="main" key="Tauriscus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tauriscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Greek actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59, 221</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurius: <entryFree id="n47567" type="main" key="Tauri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Taurii.</entryFree>
taurobolicus: <entryFree id="n47568" type="gloss" key="tauro^bo^li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŏbŏlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taurobolium</etym>, <sense id="n47568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a sacrifice of a bull</hi> (taurobolium): <cit><quote lang="la">ARA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2328</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taurobolinus: <entryFree id="n47569" type="gloss" key="tauro^bo^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŏbŏlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has sacrificed a bull to Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2353</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurobolior: <entryFree id="n47570" type="main" key="tauro^bo^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŏbŏlĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <sense id="n47570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n47570.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make a sacrifice of a bull</hi> (taurobolium; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.): matris deum sacra accepit et tauroboliatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2351</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47570.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: TAVROBOLIATA PETRA, <hi rend="ital">set up to commemorate a</hi> taurobolium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2326</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurobolium: <entryFree id="n47571" type="gloss" key="tauro^bo^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŏbŏlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sacrifice of a bull in honor of Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1899 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2322</bibl> sq.; 2130 al.</sense></entryFree>
taurocenta: <entryFree id="n47572" type="gloss" key="tauro^centa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŏcenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bull-fighter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2530</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurois: <entryFree id="n47573" type="main" key="Tauro^i_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏīs</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tauro/eis,</foreign> <sense id="n47573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress belonging to Marseilles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the seashore in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Tarento; acc.</hi> Tauroenta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tauroin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tauromenium: <entryFree id="n47574" type="main" key="Tauro^me^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏmĕnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏmĭnĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the eastern part of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Taormina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 11, 7</bibl>. — Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏmĕnon</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:475" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 475</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏmĕnītā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (the o long in <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 163</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tauromenium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tauromenian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">euripus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 100, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 461</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:256" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 256</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 66</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏmĕnītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tauromenium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurophthalmon: <entryFree id="n47575" type="greek" key="taurophthalmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurophthalmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tauro/fqalmon,</foreign> <sense id="n47575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ox-eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of rosemary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tauropolos: <entryFree id="n47576" type="main" key="Tauro^po_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŏpōlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of Diana</hi>, who, under this name, had a temple at Amphipolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
taurubulae: <entryFree id="n47577" type="main" key="Tauru^bu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurŭbŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Naples</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:129" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurulus: <entryFree id="n47578" type="hapax" key="tauru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>taurus</etym>, <sense id="n47578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bull</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taurus: <entryFree id="n47579" type="greek" key="taurus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym> = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tau=ros;</foreign> Sanscr. sthūrus; Goth. stiur; Germ. Stier</etym>, <sense id="n47579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bullock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steer.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:36 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 36 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:110 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 110 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n47579.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47579.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A brazen bull made by Perillus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that Phalaris used as an instrument of torture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 653</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:41 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 41 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47579.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Bull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation in</hi> <cb n="TAXO" /> <hi rend="ital">the zodiac</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3:20" default="NO">3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 41, 41, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47579.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small bird that imitates the lowing of oxen</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the bittern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 57, § 116</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47579.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of beetle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauri vocantur scaribaei terrestres ricino similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47579.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A root of a tree</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47579.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The surface of the body between the anus and the privy parts</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)/rros,</foreign> Fest. s. v. solitaurilia, p. 293 Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 444</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47580" type="main" key="Taurus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a high mountainrange in the south-eastern part of Asia Minor</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Allah Dagh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Bulghar Dagh</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 2, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tauri Pylae,</quote> <trans><tr>a defile between Cappadocia and Cilicia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47581" type="main" key="Taurus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tautologia: <entryFree id="n47582" type="greek" key="tauto^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tautŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tautologi/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a repetition of the same meaning in different words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tautology</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 535</bibl>; Charis, p. 242 P.</sense></entryFree>
taveni: <entryFree id="n47583" type="main" key="Taveni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taveni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tax: <entryFree id="n47584" type="hapax" key="tax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tax</orth>, <itype>an onomatopee, expressing the sound of blows</itype>, Engl. <sense id="n47584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">whack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tax tax tergo meo erit: non curo,</quote> <trans><tr>my back will get whack</tr>, <tr>whack</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit> (Ritschl reads tuxtax).</sense></entryFree>
taxa: <entryFree id="n47585" type="main" key="taxa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of laurel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxatio: <entryFree id="n47586" type="main" key="taxa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>taxo</etym>, <sense id="n47586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">valuing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appraisal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47586.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (cf. aestimatio): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus rei taxationem nos fecimus, Cic. Fragm. Or. pro Tull. 7: intra pecuniam versabitur taxatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:10:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc super omnem taxationem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxatio (succini) in deliciis tanta, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxationem confirmans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latifundī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47586.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a defining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limiting clause in wills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contracts</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:5" default="NO">33, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:6" default="NO">36, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxator: <entryFree id="n47587" type="gloss" key="taxa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reviler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abuser</hi>: scenici taxatores dicuntur, quod alter alterum maledictis tangit, Fest. s. v. taxat, p. 356 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
taxea: <entryFree id="n47588" type="main" key="taxe^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, the Gallic name for <sense id="n47588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lard</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 24</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 284 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxeota: <entryFree id="n47589" type="main" key="taxe^o_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxĕōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tacew/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n47589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxeus: <entryFree id="n47590" type="hapax" key="taxe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taxus</etym>, <sense id="n47590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the yewtree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of yew-trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taxicus: <entryFree id="n47591" type="main" key="taxi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the yewtree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum, supposed by some of the ancients to be toxica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taxilae: <entryFree id="n47592" type="main" key="Taxilae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taxilae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a people in India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxillus: <entryFree id="n47593" type="main" key="taxillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>, the primitive whence talus</etym>, <sense id="n47593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small die</hi>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 615</bibl> P. (Com. Fragm. v. 190 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxim: <entryFree id="n47594" type="main" key="taxim1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxim</orth>, <sense id="n47594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> for tetigerim; v. tango <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47595" type="main" key="taxim2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tango; lit. by touching; cf. sensim</etym>, <sense id="n47595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">little by little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> (ante - class.), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">550, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 178:20" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 178, 20</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 23 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 169:32" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 169, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taximagulus: <entryFree id="n47596" type="main" key="Taximagu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taximagŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Kent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taxo: <entryFree id="n47597" type="main" key="taxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>tago, tango</etym>, <sense id="n47597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to touch sharply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi> (post-Aug.; but cf. taxatio; syn.: tango, tracto). </sense><sense id="n47597.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">taxare pressius crebriusque est quam tangere, unde procul dubio id inclinatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 7</bibl>; Fest. pp. 356 and 357 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n47597.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47597.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To twit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">censure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reproach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charge</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tax</hi> with a fault, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassius Parmensis quādam epistolā sic taxat Augustum: Materna tibi farina, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divortium suum cum uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: in piris taxatur superbia cognomine, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they are called</hi> superba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47597.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">value</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appraise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi> the worth of a thing (qs. by feeling of or handling it; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aestimo, to judge of the value, etc.): chrysocolla aspera taxatur in libras denariis septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talentum Attieum denariis sex millibus taxat Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 136</bibl></cit>: senatorum cen sum ampliavit ac pro octingentorum milium<pb n="1845" /> <cb n="TECT" />  summa duodecies HS. taxavit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">taxato prius modo summae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n47597.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To judge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estimate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reckon</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 33, 38, § 207</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">totum sinum quatridui navigatione in longitudinem taxavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 28, 33, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modii duo anulorum Carthaginem missi, dignitasque equestris taxata mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem tuum taxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti quodque malum est, quanti illud taxavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 19:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni sapienti notum est, quanti res quaeque taxanda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 81, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taxata stipendio hiberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera taxantur modo majore,</quote> <trans><tr>more severely punished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 746" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 746</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taxoninus: <entryFree id="n47598" type="main" key="taxo_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a badger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badger.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taxus: <entryFree id="n47599" type="main" key="taxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taxus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yew</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yew-tree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 20, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:113 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 113 al.</bibl> — <cit><quote lang="la">Considered, on account of its poisonous berries, as a tree of the infernal regions,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 432</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:596" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 596</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 419</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:645 al" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 645 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47599.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a javelin</hi>, made of the wood of the yew-tree, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:210" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 210</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taygete: <entryFree id="n47600" type="main" key="Ta_y^ge^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tāygĕtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tau+ge/th,</foreign> <sense id="n47600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Atlas and Pleione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 35</bibl> (269); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 155" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taygetus: <entryFree id="n47601" type="main" key="Ta_y^ge^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tāygĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tau/+geton,</foreign> <sense id="n47601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ridge of mountains in Laconia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 50, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 14</bibl> (4, 13), 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 193</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tāygĕta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 488</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 427</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tazata: <entryFree id="n47602" type="main" key="Tazata"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tazata</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 19, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
te: <entryFree id="n47603" type="main" key="te_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tē</orth>, v. tu.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47604" type="main" key="te^2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ</orth>, <itype>a pronominal suffix</itype>, e. g. tute, tete; v tu.</entryFree>
teanum: <entryFree id="n47605" type="main" key="Te^a_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two Italian towns.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47605.1" n="I" level="1"> Teanum Apulum, <hi rend="ital">a town in Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Civitate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 13</bibl>, b, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 9, 27</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕānenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Teanum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 4</bibl>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47605.2" n="II" level="1"> Teanum Sidicinum, <hi rend="ital">a town in Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Teano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl>, B, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:57:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 57, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called simply Teanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teate: <entryFree id="n47606" type="main" key="Te^a_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕāte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Corfinium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chieti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:521" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 521</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:454" default="NO">17, 454</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕātīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Teate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teates: <entryFree id="n47607" type="main" key="Te^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Apulia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teba: <entryFree id="n47608" type="gloss" key="teba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">teba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, an old Latin term, in Varro's time still used among the Sabines, signifying <sense id="n47608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua prisca et in Graeciā Aeolis Boeotii sine afflatu vocant colles tebas: et in Sabinis, quo e Graeciā venerunt Pelasgi, etiam nunc ita dicunt: cujus vestigium in agro Sabino via Salaria non longe a Reate milliarius clivus appellatur Thebae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
techna: <entryFree id="n47609" type="greek" key="techna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">techna</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">techina</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 23</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 1, 1</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh,</foreign> <sense id="n47609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piece of craft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subtilty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">artifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cunning device</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tum igitur ego deruncinatus, deartuatus sum miser Hujus scelesti technis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
technicus: <entryFree id="n47610" type="greek" key="techni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">technĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">texniko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a teacher of art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">technologist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
technopaegnion: <entryFree id="n47611" type="greek" key="Techno^paegni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Technŏpaegnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*texnopai/gnion</foreign> (a game of art), <sense id="n47611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a poem by Ausonius.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tecmessa: <entryFree id="n47612" type="main" key="Te_^cmessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tē^cmessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of king Teuthras</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mistress of Ajax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Telamon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 517</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tecmon: <entryFree id="n47613" type="main" key="Tecmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tecmon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tecolithos: <entryFree id="n47614" type="greek" key="te_co^li^thos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēcŏlĭthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">thko/liqos</foreign> (stonedissolver), <sense id="n47614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 35, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 68, § 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tecte: <entryFree id="n47615" type="main" key="tecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tego, <sense id="n47615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tectio: <entryFree id="n47616" type="main" key="tecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <sense id="n47616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [tego], a <hi rend="ital">covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limpidae lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:58" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:21:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tectonicus: <entryFree id="n47617" type="greek" key="tecto^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tektoniko/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to building</hi>, <hi rend="ital">architectural</hi>, <cb n="TECT" /> <hi rend="ital">tectonic</hi>: formae, <hi rend="ital">designs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plans of a building</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 10, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tector: <entryFree id="n47618" type="main" key="tector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n47618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that overlays walls with plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stucco</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a plasterer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pargeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa tua, quam neque pictor neque tector vidit umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4803</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tectoriolum: <entryFree id="n47619" type="hapax" key="tecto_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectōrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tectorium</etym>, <sense id="n47619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parget</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">rough-cast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tectorium: <entryFree id="n47620" type="main" key="tecto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. tectorius, I. B. and II. B.</entryFree>
tectorius: <entryFree id="n47621" type="main" key="tecto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n47621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to covering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to a cover.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47621.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">paniculum,</quote> <trans><tr>thatch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47621.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tectō-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47621.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">that belongs to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serves for covering</hi> or <hi rend="ital">overlaying</hi> walls, ceilings, floors, etc.; <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to staining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuccoing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plastering</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque id (sepulcrum) opere tectorio exornari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: atramentum tectorium, <hi rend="ital">that serves for staining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">washing</hi> walls, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 25, § 43</bibl>: saetae e penicillis tectoriis, <hi rend="ital">plasterers</hi>' <hi rend="ital">brushes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 71, § 235</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47621.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tec-tōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">plaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stucco</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fresco-painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wash</hi> for walls, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes ac camarae munitae tectorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, sq.; 5, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 56, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:176" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 23, 55, § 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 15, 3, 3</bibl>. — Satirically, <hi rend="ital">a paste of flour put on the face to preserve the beauty of the complexion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tandem aperit vultum et tectoria prima reponit,</quote> <trans><tr>cover</tr>, <tr>coating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:467" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 467</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47621.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">smooth words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dignoscere cautus, Quid solidum crepet et pictae tectoria linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:24" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so imitated,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 1</bibl></cit> ad Volusian.</sense></entryFree>
tectosages: <entryFree id="n47622" type="main" key="Tecto^sa^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tectŏsăges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">between the Pyrenees and the Rhone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tectŏsăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Clar. Urb. Narb. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tectulum: <entryFree id="n47623" type="hapax" key="tectu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tectum</etym>, <sense id="n47623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little roof</hi>, Hier Ep. 117, n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
tectum: <entryFree id="n47624" type="main" key="tectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>. <sense id="n47624.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a covering.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47624.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A roof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quojus (villae) Deturbavit ventus tectum ac tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tecto deturbavit tegulas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>. tecta domorum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:4:section=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 4, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma tecta in domiciliis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 257</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">disturbata porticus Catuli, quae ad tectum paene pervenerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se praecipitem tecto dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmina tecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecti a culmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 480</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47624.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A ceiling</hi> (usu. plain; opp. lacunar, a fretted ceiling): tectis caelatis, laqueatis, <hi rend="ital">ceilings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rooms</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 19, 44</bibl> (Trag. v. 121 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui marmoreis tectis ebore et auro fulgentibus abundant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aurata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubilia tectaque,</quote> <trans><tr>canopies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 12, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47624.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a roofed building</hi> for dwelling in, <hi rend="ital">a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abode; a cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shelter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">prosa, ut mucronem pro gladio, et tectum pro domo recipiet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: domus, aedes, habitatio): recipe me in tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus tectis ac sedibus suis recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tecto recipiatur ... qui non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatissimi in armis, qui inter annos XIV. tectum non subissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in tecta Gallorum contegit, Auct. B. G. 8, 5: vos, Quirites, in vestra tecta discedite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectis, juvenes, succedite nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi conjunctionem tectorum oppidum vel urbem appellaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum erat ager incultus sine tecto: nunc est cultissimus cum optimā villā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vacuum tepido cepisset villula tecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars densa ferarum Tecta rapit silvas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columba plausum Dat tecto ingentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidis Clauditur in tectis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in prison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quercus tecta cibumque dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 622</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TEGO" /> dolos tecti ambagesque resolvit, i. e. of the Labyrinth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub tecta Sibyllae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 211</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tectura: <entryFree id="n47625" type="main" key="tectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n47625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a covering over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overlaying</hi> with a wash, plaster, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">parietum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit> and 17.</sense></entryFree>
tectus: <entryFree id="n47626" type="main" key="tectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of tego.</entryFree>
tecum: <entryFree id="n47627" type="main" key="te_cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēcum</orth>, i. e. cum te; v. tu.</entryFree>
ted: <entryFree id="n47628" type="main" key="ted"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ted</orth>, v. tu; and cf. med.</entryFree>
teda: <entryFree id="n47629" type="main" key="te_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēda</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">tēdĭfer</orth>, v. taeda and taedifer.</entryFree>
tedigniloquides: <entryFree id="n47630" type="main" key="Te_digni^lo^qui^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēdignĭlŏquĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>te-dignaloquens</etym>, <sense id="n47630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comically-formed proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tegea: <entryFree id="n47631" type="main" key="Te^ge^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:177" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 177</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tege/a,</foreign> <sense id="n47631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town in Arcadia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Paleo - Episkopi</hi>, near <hi rend="ital">Tripolitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:177" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 576</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n47631.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕēŭs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕaeŭs</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tegea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tegean;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 18</bibl>: virgo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Callisto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Lycaon</hi>, king of Arcadia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 167</bibl>: volucer. i. e. <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 4</bibl>. —Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Arcadian Atalanta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 317</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 380</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Carmenta</tr>, <tr>the mother of Evander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:627" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 627</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 531</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47631.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕgĕātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Mercury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>;
