<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā lege tribunitiis rogationibus telum acerrimum datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de corpore rei publicae tuorum scelerum tela revellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubrationis telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis tribunicia, telum a majoribus libertati paratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Or. Macri Licinii ad Pleb. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Or. Macri Licinii ad Pleb. 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 35, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire et linguae tela subire tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:36" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temarunda: <entryFree id="n47681" type="main" key="Temarunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Temarunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian name of the Palus Mæotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temenitis: <entryFree id="n47682" type="main" key="Te^me^ni_tis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Temenos.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47683" type="main" key="Te^me^ni_tis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni=tis</foreign> (Polyb. c. 27, 7): <sense id="n47683.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <trans><tr>a gate of Tarentum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 9, 9</bibl></cit> (v Weissenb. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
temenos: <entryFree id="n47684" type="main" key="Te^me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnos</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">te/menos, to/,</foreign> <sense id="n47684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place at Syracuse sacred to Apollo;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n47684.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni/ths,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Apollo</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 53, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47684.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*temeni=tis,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a fountain at Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temerarie: <entryFree id="n47685" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temerarius <sense id="n47685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temerarius: <entryFree id="n47686" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>temere</etym>. <sense id="n47686.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That happens by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accidental</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casual</hi> (so very rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fortuitus): sed quid hoc, quod picus ulmum tundit? hau temerarium'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temerarium est, ubi dives blande appellat pauperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: quaestus temerarius incertusque, Fest. s. v. navalis scriba, p. 169 Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">tributum temerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 364</bibl></cit>, b, ib.; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 2, p. 129 sq. — </sense><sense id="n47686.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imprudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadvised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">audacious</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: audax, audens): temulenta mulier et temeraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines temerarii atque imperiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem esse barbarum, iracundum, temerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeca ac temeraria dominatrix animi cupiditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum tam temerarius nec audax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:43:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce meo, juvenis, temerarius esse periclo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 545</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of things: ea sunt et turbulenta et temeraria et periculosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus animi temerariis partibus conpressis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: consilium, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">vox, Liv 23, 22, 9: virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 407</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sent thoughtlessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:616" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium est, ante crassitudinem pollicarem viti imperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerarium est, secundis non esse contentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temeratio: <entryFree id="n47687" type="main" key="te^me^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>temero</etym>, <sense id="n47687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forging</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 32, 1.</sense></entryFree>
temerator: <entryFree id="n47688" type="main" key="te^me^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravisher</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 600</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 53, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47688.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temere: <entryFree id="n47689" type="main" key="te^me^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrē</orth> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ-mĕrĭter</orth>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> p.; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 516, 5</bibl>; Trag. Fragm. v. 96 Rib.), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. tamra, darkening; timira, dark; hence, blindly; cf.: timor, temeritas</etym>, <sense id="n47689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by accident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at random</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intent</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">casually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortuitously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rashly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscreetly</hi>, etc. (cf.: forte, fortuito). </sense><sense id="n47689.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n47689.2" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">forte</hi> (cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 731 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam saepe forte temere Eveniunt, quae non audeas optare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pepulere ut forte temere in adversos montes agmen erigeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rideant licet quibus forte temere humana negotia agi persuasum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ista casu nonnumquam forte temere concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 15, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte, temere, casu aut pleraque fierent aut omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47689.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">casu</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortuito</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex corporibus huc et illuc casu et temere cursitantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 115</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id evenit non temere nec casu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim temere nec fortuito sati et creati sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temere ac fortuito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:186" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 55, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid temere ac fortuito, inconsiderate neglegenterque agamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: omnia<pb n="1848" /> <cb n="TEME" />  temere ac fortuito agere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> G 10</bibl>: te nihil temere, nihil imprudenter facturum judicaram, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl>, B, 1 inconsulte ac temere dicere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 1, 16, 43</bibl>. temere ac nullā ratione causas dicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 32</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, quae temere et nullo consilio administratur (opp. quae ratione regitur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47689.4" n="C" level="2"> Alone: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oracula) partim effutita temere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 2, 55, 113</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid de se temere crederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam temere tinniit tintinnabulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin 4, 2, 162</bibl></cit>. sub pinu jacentes sic temere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 14</bibl>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temere insecutae Orphea silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temere errare in vallibus,</quote> <trans><tr>at random</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 6, 327</bibl></cit>: saxa temere jacentia, Liv 9, 24, 6.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: temerius, Att. ap. Non 178, 23. — </sense><sense id="n47689.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47689.6" n="A" level="2"> Non or haud temere est, <hi rend="ital">it is not mere chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is not for nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there is a meaning in it</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere est, quod corvus cantat mihi nunc ab laevā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non temere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl> (9), 9: haud temere est, Enn. ap. Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 329</bibl> (Ann. v. 473); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 375</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47689.7" n="B" level="2"> Non temere, <hi rend="ital">not easily</hi>, = non facile: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus fluvius est hic, non hac temere transiri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hoc temere numquam amittam ego a me, Ter Phorm. 4, 5, 2: an temere quicquam Parmeno praetereat, quod facto usus sit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 38</bibl></cit>. qui hoc non temere nisi libertis suis deferebant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 13</bibl> non temere adire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 20</bibl> patres quoque non temere pro ullo aeque adnisi sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:61:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 61, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">non temere incerta casuum reputat, quem fortuna numquam decepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 30, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si negabimus temere famam nasci solere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non temere a me Quivis ferret idem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vatis avarus Non temere est animus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sibi quivis temere arroget artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:64" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also: nullus dies temere intercessit, quo non ad eum scriberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temeritas: <entryFree id="n47690" type="main" key="te^me^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <sense id="n47690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [temere]. </sense><sense id="n47690.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Hap. chance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accident</hi> (so rare but class., cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna. casus): in quibus nulla temeritas, sed ordo apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 82</bibl></cit> quid enim sors est? Idem propemodum, quod micare, quod talos jacere, quod tesseras quibus in rebus temeritas et casus, non ratio nec consilium valet, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 2, 41, 85</bibl> fortunam in temeritatem declinando corrumpebant, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 5</bibl>, cf. (Pacuvius) ait, verius esse temeritate quam fortuna res regi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 23, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa superiora caduca et incerta posita non tam in consiliis nostris quam in fortunae temeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47690.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rashness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thoughtlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">want of consideration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indiscretion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foolhardiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temerity; a rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">unfounded opinion</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word, syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">inconsiderantia, audacia): omnis actio vacare debet temeritate et neglegentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 101</bibl></cit>. multi faciunt multa temeritate quādam, sine judicio vel modo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 49</bibl>: numquam temeritas cum sapientiā miscetur. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 2, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">duci ad judicandum impetu et temeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem cupiditatemque militum reprehendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: inpellit alios avaritia, alios iracundia et temeritas, id. ib, 7, 42; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">temeritas est florentis aetatis, prudentia senescentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp prudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8</bibl></cit>; (with ignorantia) <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 42</bibl>; (with inscitia) Liv 6, 30, 6; 42, 49, 5; (with inscientia) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 12</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">rash</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsiderate acts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 28, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:97" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 97</bibl></sense></entryFree>
temeriter: <entryFree id="n47691" type="main" key="te^me^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temere <sense id="n47691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temeritudo: <entryFree id="n47692" type="hapax" key="te^me^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>temere</etym>, <sense id="n47692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rashness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heedlessness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temerity</hi> (ante-class. for temeritas), Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 181, 23</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 149 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
temero: <entryFree id="n47693" type="main" key="te^me^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕmĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.; prop. to treat rashly; hence, pregn.</etym>, <sense id="n47693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to violate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dishonor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">desecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pollute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temerare violare sacra et contaminare, dictum videlicet a temeritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=365" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 365</bibl></cit> Müll, (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; sometimes in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn., scelero, polluo): sacra deae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitii sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cereale nemus securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 741</bibl></cit>: <cb n="TEMO" /> templa Minervae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 840</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae, foci, deum delubra, sepulcra majorum temerata ac violata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">delubra oculis profanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 102</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sacra deo vasa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">sacraria probro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrium cubile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:592" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 592</bibl></cit>; 15, 501; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thalamos pudicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eandem Juliam in matrimonio Agrippae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerem maritam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 283; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">temerata Auge,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi aliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjugale praeceptum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 162, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvios venenis, Ov M. 7, 535: dapibus nefandis Corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures incestis vocibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila volatu (Perseus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:463" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 463</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:532" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 194</bibl></cit>: castra infausta temerataque, <hi rend="ital">dishonored</hi> by the crime of mutiny, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">trux puer et nullo temeratus pectora motu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 302</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">temerata est nostra voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puram fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 10, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temesa: <entryFree id="n47694" type="main" key="Te^me^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕsa</orth>, ae; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕsē</orth>, ēs; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempsa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Temsa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*teme/sh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*te/mya,</foreign> <sense id="n47694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in the territory of the Bruttians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where there were copper mines</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre del Piano del Casale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Temesa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>. Temese, Ov M. 15, 52; 15, 707; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempsa (Temsa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 45, 4</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47694.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕmĕsae-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Temesa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Temesan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F 5, 441</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:47" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47694.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempsānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Temesa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 15, § 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temetum: <entryFree id="n47695" type="main" key="te_me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>a lengthened form from root tam-; Sanscr tām-yati, to be stupefied; whence abstemius, temulentus</etym>, <sense id="n47695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any intoxicating drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, etc. (mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. merum): temeti nihil allatum intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 14, § 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 59</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 5, 17</bibl>; Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl> Müll., Hor Ep. 2, 2, 163; Juv 15, 25; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 6</bibl> (Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 15, 15</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 23, 1</bibl>.—Jocosely: temeti timor, as a name for <hi rend="ital">a parasite</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 17 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
temnibilis: <entryFree id="n47696" type="main" key="temni^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">temnĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>temno</etym>, <sense id="n47696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">despicable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemptible</hi>: nec exiguitate temnibilis (amnis). <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div Litt. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temnites: <entryFree id="n47697" type="main" key="Temni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Temnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Temnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Temnos.</entryFree>
temno: <entryFree id="n47698" type="main" key="temno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">temno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root tam-, to cut; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n47698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disdain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">despise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare for the class. contemnere); <cit><quote lang="la">semper aves quod abest praesentia temnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 957</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jejunus raro stomachus vulgaria temnit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteritum temnens extremos inter euntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne temne, quod ultro Praeferimus manibus vittas et verba precantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars non temnenda decoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 299</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud temnendae manus ductor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temnos: <entryFree id="n47699" type="main" key="Te_mnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēmnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*th=mnos,</foreign> <sense id="n47699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Æolia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Menimen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 42 al.</bibl>—Hence, ‡ </sense><sense id="n47699.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Temni-tes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. m.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Temnos</hi> Heraclides, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 42</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tem-nītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Temnos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Temnites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 19, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47699.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tem-nĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Temnos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Temnians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temo: <entryFree id="n47700" type="main" key="te_mo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root tek-; cf.: texo, telum</etym>, <sense id="n47700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tongue</hi> of a plough, carriage, cart, etc. </sense><sense id="n47700.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Varr L. L. 7, § 73; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl>; Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 109; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 107</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 258 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n47700.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47700.3" n="A" level="2"> (Pars pro toto.) <hi rend="ital">A wagon</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">de temone Britanno Excidet Arviragus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 126</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47700.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation called the Wain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Wagon of Bootes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Charles</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s Wain</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 73</bibl> (Trag. v. 245 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:370" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 370</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 692</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 1</bibl>. 1.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:447" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 447</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47700.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47701" type="main" key="temo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">temo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sum of money paid instead of furnishing recruits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">commutationmoney</hi>, Cod. Th. 6, 26, 14 sq.</sense></entryFree>
temonarius: <entryFree id="n47702" type="main" key="temo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">temōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. temo</etym>, <sense id="n47702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the commutation for recruits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 24, 1</bibl></cit>. functio, Cod. Th. 11, 16, 14.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">temōnā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a collector of the commutation for recruits</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 29, 2</bibl>. <cb n="TEMP" /></sense></entryFree>
tempe: <entryFree id="n47703" type="main" key="Tempe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempē</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <sense id="n47703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur. n.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/mph, ta(</foreign> </sense><sense id="n47703.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a charming valley in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through which ran the river Peneus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Olympus and Ossa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">valley of Lykostomo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Dereli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 1, 24: Peneia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 317</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 222</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47703.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other beautiful valleys: <cit><quote lang="la">frigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 469</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:477" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 477</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cycneia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 371</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:485" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 485</bibl> (cf. written as Greek: Reatini me ad sua <foreign lang="greek">te/mph</foreign> duxerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
temperaculum: <entryFree id="n47704" type="hapax" key="tempe^ra_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tempero</etym>, <sense id="n47704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 342, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temperamentum: <entryFree id="n47705" type="main" key="tempe^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixing in due proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a proper measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">constitution; a measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderation; temperament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperature</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; cf. on the other hand, temperatio): inventum est temperamentum, quo tenuiores cum principibus aequari se putarunt, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto temperamento inter plebem senatumque egit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:3" default="NO">44, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium principatus temperamentum, si demptis utriusque vitiis solae virtutes miscerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus Caesar orationem habuit meditato temperamento,</quote> <trans><tr>with studied moderation</tr>, <tr>strictness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temperamentum omnes in illo subito pietatis calore servavimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est inter has tam diversas inaequalitates magno temperamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:12:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 12, 3 sq.</bibl></cit> eruca jungitur lactucae fere in cibis, ut nimio frigori par fervor immixtus temperamentum aequet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 155</bibl> eadem est materia, sed distat temperamento, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">combination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:130:12:25:54:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 36, 61, § 130, 12, 25, 54, § 115</bibl> caeli, <hi rend="ital">temperateness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linistis absque temperamento,</quote> <trans><tr>without having tempered the mortar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temperans: <entryFree id="n47706" type="main" key="tempe^rans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tempero.</entryFree>
temperanter: <entryFree id="n47707" type="main" key="tempe^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temperans.</entryFree>
temperantia: <entryFree id="n47708" type="main" key="tempe^ranti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>temperans</etym>, <sense id="n47708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sobriety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discreetness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperateness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperance</hi>, as a moral qual ity: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (virtutis vis) moderandis cupidi tatibus regendisque animi motibus laudatur, ejus est munus in agendo: cui temperantiae nomen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 22, 76</bibl></cit>. temperantia est rationis in libidinem atque in alios non rectos impetus animi firma et moderata dominatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia est, quae in rebus aut expetendis aut fugiendis rationem ut sequamur, monet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: temperans, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">sw/frono</foreign> appellant eamque virtutem <foreign lang="greek">swfrosu/nhn</foreign> vo cant, quam soleo equidem tum temperantiam, tum moderationem appellare, nonnumquam etiam modestiam, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum versatur ... in omnium quae fiunt quaeque dicuntur ordine et modo, in quo inest modestia et temperantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernitur altera pars honestatis in conformatione et moderatione continentiae et temperantiae, id. ib 3, 25, 96: novi ego temperantiam et moderationem naturae tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit> dicacitatis moderatio et temperantia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 247</bibl> temperantia in victu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Divitiaci) summam in se voluntatem, egregiam fidem, temperantiam cognoverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā temperantiā moderatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, sine apparatu expellunt famem: adversus sitim non eādem temperantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 23</bibl></cit>, and valetudinem temperantiā mitigare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
temperate: <entryFree id="n47709" type="main" key="tempe^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tempero, <sense id="n47709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temperatio: <entryFree id="n47710" type="main" key="tempe^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tempero</etym>. <sense id="n47710.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a due mingling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tempering</hi> of ingredients, <hi rend="ital">fit proportion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">combination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">symmetry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constitution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperament</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in Cic.); <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim corporis temperatio cum ea congruunt inter se, e quibus constamus, sanitas: sic animi dicitur, cum ejus judicia opinionesque concordant: eaque animi est virtus, quam alii ipsam temperantiam dicunt esse, alii obtemperantem temperantiae praeceptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 10, 21: aeris temperatio,</quote> <trans><tr>composition</tr>, <tr>temper</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 2, 4, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 26, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerulei temperationes Alexandriae primum sunt inventae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>; quae a luna ceterisque<pb n="1849" /> <cb n="TEMP" />  sideribus caeli temperatio fit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatio lunae caelique moderatio efficit hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina temperatione caloris et oriri et augescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensium temperatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina ac temperatio civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>organization</tr>, <tr>constitution</tr>.</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatio juris, cum potestas in populo, auctoritas in senatu sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: sed praesto est hujus vitii temperatio, quod senatus lege nostra confirmatur auctoritas, <hi rend="ital">a means of moderating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qualifying</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tempering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 27.—</sense><sense id="n47710.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: sol dux et princeps et moderator luminum reliquorum, mens mundi et temperatio, <hi rend="ital">the organizing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ordering principle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl> (Somn. Scip. 4, 10).</sense></entryFree>
temperativus: <entryFree id="n47711" type="hapax" key="tempe^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempero</etym>, <sense id="n47711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">palliative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temperator: <entryFree id="n47712" type="main" key="tempe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who duly arranges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orders</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">governs</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">moderator ille et quasi temperator hujus tripartitae varietatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who enjoys it in moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum (flumen),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that rightly tempers them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:55:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 55, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temperatura: <entryFree id="n47713" type="main" key="tempe^ra_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">due measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quality; temper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperature</hi> (anteclass. and post-Aug. for the class. temperatio): caeli temperatura, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 2, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:75" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilis ac salubris (in balneis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linire absque temperatura,</quote> <trans><tr>with untempered mortar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temperatus: <entryFree id="n47714" type="main" key="tempe^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of tempero.</entryFree>
temperi: <entryFree id="n47715" type="main" key="tempe^ri_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrī</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭus</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tempus, II. A.</entryFree>
temperies: <entryFree id="n47716" type="main" key="tempe^ri^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tempero</etym>, <sense id="n47716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a due mingling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mixture</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tempering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temper</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post - Aug. prose for the class. temperatio): <cit><quote lang="la">in quo (aere) aequalis omnium temperies fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna et in colore temperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 78, 80, § 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:54" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 11, 22, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi temperiem sumpsere umorque calorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix tegit alta duas (caeli zonas): totidem inter utramque locavit, Temperiemque dedit, mixtā cum frigore flammā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>temperateness</tr>, <tr>moderate temperature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 7, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli mira temperies, verno tepori maxime similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:1:11" default="NO">9, 1, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus mitis inter juvenemque senemque Temperie medius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperie blandarum captus aquarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperiem servant oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>a due proportion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquilla morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2</bibl></cit>. 6, 48: <cit><quote lang="la">temperies (docet), ut casta petas,</quote> <trans><tr>moderation</tr>, <tr>temperance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tempero: <entryFree id="n47717" type="main" key="tempe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old <sense id="n47717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres. subj.</hi> temperint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 41</bibl>; collat. <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕror</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 5, 12</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tempus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47717.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proportion duly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mingle in due proportion; to combine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compound properly; to qualify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temper</hi>, etc. (class.; cf.: modifico, misceo). </sense><sense id="n47717.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero qui simplex esse debet, ex dissimilibus rebus misceri et temperari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (orbium motus) acuta cum gravibus temperans varios aequabiliter concentus efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea cum tria sumpsisset, unam in speciem temperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale quiddam esse animum, ut sit ex igni atque animă temperatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes conflare et temperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:402" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 402</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum melle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 17, 21, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 11, § 50</bibl></cit>: pocula, <hi rend="ital">to flavor</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 2, 2, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 10, 59, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 18, 16, § 79</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ejusdem solis tum accessus modici tum recessus et frigoris et caloris modum temperant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesiarum flatu nimii temperantur calores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 53, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis solem umbra temperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 91</bibl></cit>: quis aquam (i. e. balneum) temperet ignibus, <hi rend="ital">who shall temper</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">warm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 6</bibl>; so, balneum, <cb n="TEMP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:25:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scatebrisque arentia temperat arva,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 110</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arva (Galesus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Prob. 260</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rule</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">govern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam institutis et legibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere et temperare civitates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus, qui Lacedaemoniorum rem publicam temperavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Juppiter) res hominum ac deorum, Qui mare ac terras variisque mundum Temperat horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram, mare, urbes, etc. (corresp. to regere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 770</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 869</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces aetherias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:859" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 859</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:580" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus id navigii genus temperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:107" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pretio temperata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem delirum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora frenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">genius qui natale temperat astrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 6, 4, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli fulgura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam suo arbitrio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 137</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen impositis articulis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to tune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl></cit> (3, 32), 80; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">testudinis aureae strepitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musam pede Archilochi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 28 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citharam nervis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to string</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 108</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47717.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47717.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To regulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rule</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non modice temperatam sed nimis meracam libertatem sitiens haurire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus acerbitas morum immanitasque naturae ne vino quidem permixta temperari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (genus) erit aequatum et temperatum ex tribus optimis rerum publicarum modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in variā et perpetuā oratione hi (numeri) sunt inter se miscendi et temperandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:58:197" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 58, 197</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">joined with miscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 119</bibl></cit> (on the contrary, opp. miscere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at haec interdum temperanda et varianda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:103" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iracundiam cohibere, victoriam temperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara lento Temperet risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: annonam macelli quotannis temperandam censuit, <hi rend="ital">to be regulated</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">fixed at moderate prices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aeolus) Sceptra tenens mollitque animos et temperat iras,</quote> <trans><tr>soothes</tr>, <tr>allays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurius temperat astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 305</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.6" n="2" level="3"> Se temperare ab aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to refrain from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstain from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbear</hi>, etc. (late Lat.): temperare se a rectorum suorum reprehensione, Greg. M. in Job, 25, 38 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 18, 3: ab utro se temperat, Aug. c. Faust. 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3</bibl> prooem.</sense><sense id="n47717.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to observe proper measure; to moderate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restrain one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self; to forbear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstain; to be moderate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi> (class.; cf. moderor). </sense><sense id="n47717.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <hi rend="ital">in aliquā re</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alicui rei</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ab aliquā re</hi>, a simple <case>abl.</case>, an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47717.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam istoc probior es, cum in amore temperes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in multa temperarunt tribuni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae tempera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.11" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperare ab injuriā et maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a maleficio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus ducis mitigati ab excidio civitatis temperavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 63</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sibi in contionibus credas a mendacio temperaturum?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 18, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne a necessariis quidem sibi rabies temperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:26:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.12" n="(d)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a venatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Laud. Stil. 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: neque verbis adversus principem neque factis, Suet. Vit. Lucan.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae Canorā hic voce suā tinnire temperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dormire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicere huic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: tollere puerum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:21:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 21, 42</bibl> (Trag. v. 67 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">exordiri rem novam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9, 5</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi male faciundi est potestas, quom ne id faciat temperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in pluribus libris ne facerem temperavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">non temperante Tiberio quin premeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl></cit>: ne sedato quidem tumultu temperare potuit, <cb n="TEMP" /> quin, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix temperabat, quin diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 10, 1</bibl></cit> (30), 7: <cit><quote lang="la">Arruntius non temperavit, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 114, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.13" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi> or <hi rend="ital">animis</hi> (so not in Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">neque sibi homines feros temperaturos existimabat, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix sibi temperant quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl>: usque mihi temperavi, dum perducerem eo rem, ut, etc., Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo mihi temperare, quominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes">1</bibl>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">30: non quivit temperare sibi in eo (signo), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix temperavere animis, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.14" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegre temperatum est, quin, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>they with difficulty refrained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec temperatum manibus foret, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam superfundenti se laetitiae vix temperatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppugnatione urbium temperatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47717.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic., pregn., <hi rend="ital">to forbear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abstain</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">refrain from;
