to spare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be indulgent to</hi> any thing (cf.: parco, abstineo); constr. with <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si cuiquam ullā in re umquam temperaverit, ut vos quoque ei temperetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superatis hostibus (shortly after, parcere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">4: sociis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 59</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">154: alicui in aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">17: amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 98 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo ab sociis temperaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his sacris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis a plerisque cibis singuli temperemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a mulso sibi temperare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templis deum temperatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 6</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ab ullo temperatum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 31, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47717.16" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕ-rans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">observing moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">modestus, abstinens): aut temperantem (dices), qui se in aliquā libidine continuerit, in aliquā effuderit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in omnibus vitae partibus moderatus ac temperans, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 18, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo sanctissimus et temperantissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 17, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes graviores temperantioresque a cupidine imperii,</quote> <trans><tr>refraining</tr>, <tr>abstaining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 22, 14</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famae temperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperans gaudii seraeque laetitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:52:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 52, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatis temperantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 29</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl>, A, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.— </sense><sense id="n47717.17" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> * </sense><sense id="n47717.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Duly arranged</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Limited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47717.20" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatae escae modicaeque potiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones caeli neque aestuosae neque frigidae sed temperatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 26</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca temperatiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o temperatae dulce Formiae litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis ac temperatus annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatissimum anni tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47717.21" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of moral character, of speech, etc., <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sober</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steady</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem ita temperatis moderatisque moribus, ut summa severitas summā cum humanitate jungatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justi, temperati, sapientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:36:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 36, 87</bibl></cit>: in victoriā tem, peratior, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens in bonis Ab insolenti temperata Laetitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim temperatam di provehunt In majus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum temperatum virtutibus fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc multo fortius est ... illud temperatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequabile et temperatum orationis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio modica ac temperata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 95</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatior oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:53:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 53, 212</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatissimi sanctissimique viri monumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:38:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 38, § 83</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempĕrātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in due proportion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temperately.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47717.22" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tepebit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 69, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores umoris temperate, parum terreni habentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47717.23" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatius scribere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatissime et castissime vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mus. 6:15" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mus. 6, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tempestas: <entryFree id="n47718" type="main" key="tempestas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempe-stūs</orth>, ūtis; <sense id="n47718.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> tempestatium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tempus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47718.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <pb n="1850" /> <cb n="TEMP" /> <hi rend="ital">portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">point</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">space of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">w(/ra</foreign> (so mostly ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. tempus): SOL OCCASVS SVPREMA TEMPESTAS ESTO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in duodecim tabulis: SOLIS OCCASV DIEI SVPREMA TEMPESTAS ESTO: libri augurum pro tempestate tempestutem dicunt, supremum augurii tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=51" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 51</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: jam quā tempestate vivo certe sine ad me recipio, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 407, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā tempestate flos poëtarum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum tempestas quondam cum vixi fuit, Quom, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādemque tempestate multis signis Lacedaemoniis calamitas denuntiabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā tempestate juvencos egerat a stabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego pro mundi regno magis anxius illā Tempestate fui, qua, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 183</bibl></cit>: tertia te Phthiae tempestas laeta locabit, <hi rend="ital">the third day</hi> (a translation of the Homeric <foreign lang="greek">h)/mati/ ken trita/tw|,</foreign> Il. 9, 363), Cic. poët. Div. 1, 25, 52: <cit><quote lang="la">quā tempestate Poenus in Italiam venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:38:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 38, 153</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuere item eā tempestate, qui crederent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:15" default="NO">6, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā tempestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac tempestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:2:8" default="NO">25, 2, 8</bibl>: sic omnia nimia, cum vel in tempestate vel in agris vel in corporibus laetiora fuerunt, in contraria fere convertuntur (a transl. of the Platonic <foreign lang="greek">e)n w(/rais te kai\ e)n futoi=s kai\ e)n sw/masi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 44, 68</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: quam te post multis tueor tempestatibus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 407, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cis paucas tempestates, augebis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis tempestatibus haud sane quisquam Romae virtute magnus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla sollertissimus omnium in paucis tempestatibus factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Evander, qui multis ante tempestatibus ea tenuerat loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47718.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Time</hi>, with respect to its physical qualities, <hi rend="ital">weather</hi> (the predom. and class. signif. of the word). </sense><sense id="n47718.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of good as well as of bad weather: tum tonuit laevum bene tempestate serenā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl> (Ann. v. 517 Vahl.; cf. infra, in <number>plur.</number>); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 408, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">liquidissima caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nactus idoneam ad navigandum tempestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit pridie Quinquatrus egregia tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestatem praetermittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tempestas arridet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1395</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde haec tam clara repente Tempestas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: tempestates serenae riserunt risu Jovis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 254</bibl> (Ann. v. 445 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempestates assunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et comites et tempestates et navem idoneam ut habeas, diligenter videbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47718.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of bad or stormy weather, <hi rend="ital">a storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempest</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">procella, hiemps): turbida tempestas heri fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">turbida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 376</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 458</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfrigida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbulenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">26: foeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 323</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissa ab Euro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas venit, Confringit tegulas imbricesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta tempestas cooritur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas naves adflixit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis tempestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximo imbri, tempestate, ventis, procellis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautae cum adversā tempestate in alto jactarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si segetibus tempestas nocuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tempestas a vertice silvis Incubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas sine more furit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 694</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo genera esse caelestis injuriae meminisse debemus: unum quod tempestates vocamus, in quibus grandines, procellae, ceteraque similia intelleguntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 69, § 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis commotis tempestatibus, fluvius ita magnus factus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:31:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 31, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam summi gubernatores in magnis tempestatibus a vectoribus admoneri solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tempestates saepe certo aliquo caeli signo commoventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procellae, tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47718.5" n="3" level="3"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempestātes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the weather-goddesses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the weather</hi>: (Lucius <cb n="TEMP" /> Scipio) CEPIT. CORSICA. ALERIAQVE. VRBE. DEDET TEMPESTATIBVS AIDE MERITO, Inscrr. Scip. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 24</bibl>; cf. in <number>sing.</number> Tempestas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 6, 193</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47718.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (like our <hi rend="ital">storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempest</hi>, = ), <hi rend="ital">commotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturbance; calamity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in hac tempestate populi jactemur et fluctibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video quanta tempestas invidiae nobis impendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas horribilis Gallici adventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta per Idaeos tempestas ierit campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā ipsā tempestate eversam esse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:67:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 67, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis illa fuit et ruina quaedam atque tempestas et quidvis potius quam judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 35, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis Siculorum tempestas (i. e. Verres),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ignari quanta invidiae immineret tempestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(scurra) Pernicies et tempestates barathrumque macelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:229" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 229</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 63" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 63</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his undis et tempestatibus ad summam senectutem maluit jactari quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immoderatae tempestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis rei publicae fluitans in alto tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 85 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47718.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A storm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shower</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a throng</hi>, <hi rend="ital">multitude</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbida telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 284</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tempestive: <entryFree id="n47719" type="main" key="tempesti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tempestivus <sense id="n47719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tempestivitas: <entryFree id="n47720" type="main" key="tempesti_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tempestivus</etym>, <sense id="n47720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timeliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonableness</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n47720.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: sua cuique parti aetatis tempestivitas est data, <hi rend="ital">its appropriate quality</hi> or <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 14, 14, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:303" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 30, 73, § 303</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47720.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a right</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proper state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestivitates stomachi totiusque corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 38, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tempestivo: <entryFree id="n47721" type="main" key="tempesti_vo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestīvō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">=</orth> <itype>tempestive</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 41</bibl> (dub.; al. tempestive).</entryFree>
tempestivus: <entryFree id="n47722" type="main" key="tempesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vos</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempestas, I.</etym>, <sense id="n47722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the right time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">done</hi> or <hi rend="ital">happening at the proper time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fitting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suitable</hi> (class.; syn. opportunus). </sense><sense id="n47722.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum tempestivo ad navigandum mari, Siciliam adiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggressus tempestivis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">veniet narratibus hora Tempestiva meis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 500</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et tempestivum pueris concedere ludum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesura arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vindemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:67" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarritio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:4" default="NO">7, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa mihi ipsi ad mortem tempestiva fuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>fitting occasions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:109" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num parum tempestivos interveni?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula maestis tempestiva genis posuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:355" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 355</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tempestivom erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 188</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47722.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47722.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Timely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ripe</hi> (syn. maturus): <cit><quote lang="la">maturitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ocymum tempestivom erit, dato primum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullorum examina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 256</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassita in sementes forte concesserat tempestiviores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47722.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">ripe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mature</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tempestiva viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 12</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">filia Jam matura viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 53</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">matura virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>); so, <cit><quote lang="la">Rhode,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo, Fest. s. v. Romam, p. 269 Müll.: tempestivos erat caelo Cythereïus heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:584" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 584</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47722.5" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., like our <hi rend="ital">timely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betimes</hi>, for that which takes place early, <hi rend="ital">in good time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">early;</hi> so in the elder Pliny, of early risers: <cit><quote lang="la">refrigeratum sub dio dari tempestivis antecedente vomitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 25, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sani atque tempestivi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 181</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of early banquets, beginning while it is yet day: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">convivia (convivium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solemni et tempestivo adhibetur convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:28:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 28, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cb n="TEMP" /> tempestivis epulis delinitus, ubi vino incaluit, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 37</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at the right time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in proper season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasonably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunely; fitly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriately</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">arare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:81" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 9</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
tempestuosus: <entryFree id="n47723" type="hapax" key="tempestu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempestas, II.</etym>, <sense id="n47723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stormy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempestuous; turbulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impetuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incursus hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tempestus: <entryFree id="n47724" type="gloss" key="tempestu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempestūs</orth>, <itype>ūtis</itype>, v. tempestas <sense id="n47724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
templaris: <entryFree id="n47725" type="hapax" key="templa_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">templāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>templum</etym>, <sense id="n47725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a temple</hi>: fines, Auct. Limit. p. 295 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
templatim: <entryFree id="n47726" type="hapax" key="templa_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">templātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>templum, analogous to vicatim, from vicus</etym>, <sense id="n47726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">templewards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the temples</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
templum: <entryFree id="n47727" type="main" key="templum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">templum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>prob. for temulum; root <foreign lang="greek">tem-</foreign> of <foreign lang="greek">te/mnw;</foreign> cf. <foreign lang="greek">te/menos,</foreign> a sacred enclosure; hence</etym>, <sense id="n47727.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, a space marked out; hence, in partic., in augury, <hi rend="ital">an open place for observation</hi>, marked out by the augur with his staff: <cit><quote lang="la">templum dicitur locus manu auguris designatus in aëre, post quem factum ilico captantur auguria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum templum locus augurii aut auspicii causā quibusdam conceptis verbis finitus. Concipitur verbis non isdem usquequaquae. In Arce sic: templa tescaque me ita sunto quoad ego caste lingua nuncupavero. Olla veter arbor, quirquir est, quam me sentio dixisse, templum tescumque finito in sinistrum, etc. ... In hoc templo faciundo arbores constitui fines apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6 sq.</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Palatium Romulus, Remus Aventinum ad inaugurandum templa capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47727.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, with the idea of openness, extent, or that of sanctity predominating. </sense><sense id="n47727.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad space</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circuit</hi> (so rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): unus erit, quem tu tolles in caerula caeli Templa, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the space</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circuit of the heavens</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 67); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mare nec tellus neque caeli lucida templa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1014" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1014</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1064</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1105" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 1105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1039" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1039</bibl>; 6, 286; 6, 644; 6, 1228; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 388</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:670" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 670</bibl>: magna caelitum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 227 Vahl.): magnum Jovis altitonantis, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 7</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 531 Vahl.): mundi magnum et vorsatile templum, <hi rend="ital">the extent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circuit of the world</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1436</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 43</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus, cujus hoc templum est omne quod conspicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Somn. Scip. 3, 6: globus, quem in hoc templo medium vides, quae terra dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>: Acherusia templa alta Orci, salvete, infera, <hi rend="ital">spaces</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 6</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 107 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the plain of the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca Neptunia templaque turbulenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 4</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the hollow space</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chamber</hi> of the mouth: <cit><quote lang="la">umida linguaï circum sidentia templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 624</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47727.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A consecrated</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sacred place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sanctuary</hi> (syn.: aedes, fanum). </sense><sense id="n47727.4" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sacerdotes) urbem et agros et templa liberata et effata habento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc effari templa dicuntur ab auguribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=53" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 53</bibl></cit> Müll.—Of <hi rend="ital">the Rostra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Rostris, in illo inquam inaugurato templo ac loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rostraque id templum appellatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 29, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 35, 8</bibl> Drak.—Of <hi rend="ital">the Curia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">templum ordini ab se aucto Curiam fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 30, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 31, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 33, 4</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a tribunal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 10</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:12:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 12, 11</bibl>. —Of <hi rend="ital">an asylum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47727.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sanctuary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus templaque mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(curia) templum sanctitatis, amplitudinis, mentis, consilii publici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47727.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a place dedicated to some particular deity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shrine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonis Sospitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 446</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:840" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 840</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiqua deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec templa refeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudo amica templis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templorum positor, templorum sancte repostor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:63" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 63</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the sepulchral monument</hi> of Sychaeus, to whom divine honors were paid, <pb n="1851" /> <cb n="TEMP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 457</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:84" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47727.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small timber;</hi> in architecture, <hi rend="ital">a purlin</hi> lying horizontally upon the rafters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl> and 7; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">templum significat et tignum, quod in aedificio transversum ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=367" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 367</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
temporalis: <entryFree id="n47728" type="main" key="tempo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempus</etym>. <sense id="n47728.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasting but for a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporal</hi> (mostly postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">pa/qos</foreign> temporale esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:95" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 10, 95</bibl></cit>: ARAE, <hi rend="ital">erected for the occasion</hi>, Inscr. ap. Marin. Fratr. Arv. 43, 16; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. perpetuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47728.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in gram.: <cit><quote lang="la">temporale verbum,</quote> <trans><tr>denoting time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=108" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 108</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen (as annus, mensis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 581</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia (e.g. pridem, nunc, modo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 1017</bibl></cit> ib.—</sense><sense id="n47728.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the temples</hi> of the head: <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <trans><tr>the temporal veins</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporarily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observata lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
temporalitas: <entryFree id="n47729" type="main" key="tempo^ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>temporalis, I.</etym>, <sense id="n47729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">temporariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporality; present custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> (opp. aeternitas; <cit><quote lang="la">eccl. Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
temporaliter: <entryFree id="n47730" type="main" key="tempo^ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temporalis <sense id="n47730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temporaneus: <entryFree id="n47731" type="main" key="tempo^ra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempus</etym>, <sense id="n47731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">happening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coming at the right time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">timely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportune</hi> (late Lat. for tempestivus): <cit><quote lang="la">lux nostra erumpat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 13:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 13, 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agricola) patienter ferens donec accipiat temporaneum et serotinum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the early and the latter rain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
temporarie: <entryFree id="n47732" type="main" key="tempo^ra_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrārĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. temporarius <sense id="n47732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
temporarius: <entryFree id="n47733" type="main" key="tempo^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tempus</etym>, <sense id="n47733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasting but for a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporary</hi> (perh. only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitas,</quote> <trans><tr>depending on</tr>, <tr>according to the time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae, quas temporarias populus adpellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mora (opp. aeternitatis destinatione),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 7, 17, § 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animi (ira),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia,</quote> <trans><tr>changeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ergo temporarium et subitum est, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:91:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 91, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum temporaria gravitas, vel potius gravitatis imitatio ridebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 6, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum hoc (sc. sanguis) in corpore temporarium sentit incrementum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 90, § 223</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrārĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">temporarily</hi>, Salv. Gub. Dei, 5, 8; 7, 22.</sense></entryFree>
temporatim: <entryFree id="n47734" type="main" key="tempo^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">at times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chronologically</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra temporatim vestiri amans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nativitates nominatim temporatimque digerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tempori: <entryFree id="n47735" type="main" key="tempo^ri_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏrī</orth> <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tempus, II. A.</entryFree>
tempsa: <entryFree id="n47736" type="main" key="Tempsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempsa</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tempsānus</orth>, v. Temesa.</entryFree>
temptabundus: <entryFree id="n47737" type="main" key="tempta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">temptābundus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tempto</orth>, etc., v. tent-.</entryFree>
tempus: <entryFree id="n47738" type="main" key="tempus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tempus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (<sense id="n47738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. temp.</hi> tempori or temperi; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. root tem-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/mnw;</foreign> prop. a section; hence, in partic., of time</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47738.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a portion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">period of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus diei,</quote> <trans><tr>daytime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>morning hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anni tempora,</quote> <trans><tr>the seasons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1396" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1396</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Ennam) circa sunt laetissimi flores omni tempore anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturius paulo, quam tempus anni postulabat, in hiberna exercitum deduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat hibernum tempus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 43, 1.—</sense><sense id="n47738.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp. of the time intervening between two events, etc., <hi rend="ital">an interval</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:25" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1:1" default="NO">16, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:4" default="NO">4, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:6" default="NO">12, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longis temporibus ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47738.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, in general. </sense><sense id="n47738.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47738.5" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus est, id quo nunc utimur (nam ipsum quidem generaliter definire difficile est), pars quaedam aeternitatis cum alicujus annui, menstrui, diurni nocturnive spatii certā significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus esse dicunt intervallum mundi motus: id divisum in partes aliquot, maxime ab solis et lunae cursu: itaque ab eorum tenore temperato tempus dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 2</bibl></cit> Müll.: hos siderum errores id ipsum esse, quod <cb n="TEMP" /> rite dicitur tempus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ut celari posset, tempus spatium ullum dabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi tempus et spatium datum sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix huic tantulae epistulae tempus habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egeo tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unius horae tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot dierum tempus amisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus duorum mensium petere ad delectus habendos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta dierum tempus petens, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus, pacis an belli, festinationis an otii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tempora postulabant belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec belli tantum temporibus, sed etiam in pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus Punici belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:4:11" default="NO">43, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero omne tempus est ad meos libros vacuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit, erit illud profecto tempus et illucescet ille aliquando dies, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo tempore tu me diligere coepisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo tempore, quo promulgatum de multā ejus traditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 10, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore, quo in homine non ut nunc omnia consentientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 32, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatum eo tempore Quinctium fuisse, cum sacramento adacti sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per idem tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ad me id temporis venturos esse praedixeram,</quote> <trans><tr>at that time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripta in aliquod tempus reponantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantulum Umquam intermittit tempus, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno et eodem temporis puncto nati . . . nascendi tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alienum tempus est mihi tecum expostulandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare tempus exponendi de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">committendi proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyranno ad consultandum tempus datum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datum cum iis conloquendi tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 24, 11</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">id certis temporibus futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:15:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 15, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Athenienses quibusdam temporibus nihil nisi, etc., agebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioribus temporibus ad te nullas litteras misi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illis temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporibus illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47738.6" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fitting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appointed time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the right season</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proper period</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opportunity</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kairo/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc occasio est et tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus maximum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero ego, mihi quoque Tempus tale eventurum, ut tibi gratiam referam parem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus habes tale, quale nemo habuit umquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicas: tempus maxumum esse ut eat domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hora, viri, nunc tempus: adeste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:194" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul paulisper addubitavit, an consurgendi jam triariis tempus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam moriendi tempus urgueret,</quote> <trans><tr>was close at hand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verno inserentis tempus urguet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 113</bibl></cit>: tempus est, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam tempus est, ad id quod instituimus accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid de ordine argumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conari etiam majora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc corpora curare tempus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi abire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tempus agi res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus est jam hinc abire me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>at a fitting time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:60:section=139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 60, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47738.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempŏra</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (less freq. in the <number>sing.</number> tempus), after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta\ kai/ria</foreign> (prop. the right place, the fatal spot), <hi rend="ital">the temples</hi> of the head; <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae suturae super aures tempora a superiore capitis parte discernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:930" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 930</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1194" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 416</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 32</bibl>; 4, 8, 33 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contorquet brachium et Graccho percutit tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:414" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:44" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 44</bibl> Duk. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 26</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">the face</hi>, <hi rend="ital">visage</hi> in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl> (3, 18), 3; 2, 18, 32 (3, 11, 10).—<hi rend="ital">The head</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacuit pulsus tria tempora ramo Cacus,</quote> <trans><tr>upon his three heads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 15.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulum movens Cana tempus anilitas Omnia omnibus annuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 162</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47738.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47738.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The time</hi> in its moral aspects; <hi rend="ital">the state of the times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condition;</hi> in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi> <cb n="TEMP" /> (esp. freq. of dangerous or distressful cir cumstances): <cit><quote lang="la">si ad tuum tempus perduci tur, facilis gubernatio est,</quote> <trans><tr>time of administration</tr>, <tr>consulship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne meum tempus amicorum temporibus transmittendum putavi ... et meus labor in privatorum periculis versatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid a me cujusque tempus poscat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori meo defuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>my necessity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tot annos ita vivo, ut a nullius umquam me tempore aut commodo aut otium meum abstraxerit aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori cedere, id est necessitati parere, semper sapientis est habitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte temporis causā nobis adsentiebare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque poëtae tempori meo defuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 123</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suscipere onus laboris atque officii ex necessariorum tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summo et periculosissimo rei publicae tempore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore summo rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam conferre in rei publicae magnum aliquod tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tempore atque periculo exercitum conparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o saepe mecum tempus in ultimum Deducte,</quote> <trans><tr>to the last extremity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eae (res) contra nos faciunt in hoc tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>at the present time</tr>, <tr>under the present circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 1</bibl></cit>;
